notification.noSufficientPermissions: No sufficient permissions to access this page
notification.disabled: You cannot edit a disabled item

conflict.budget: Budget with code {{ code }} already exists.
conflict.costCenter: Cost center with code {{ code }} already exists.
conflict.unit: Organizational unit with uid {{ code }} already exists.
conflict.user: User with email {{ code }} already exists
conflict.userGroup: User Group with id {{ code }} already exists
conflict.permission: Approval Permission with code {{ code }} already exists.

orgCostCenter.name: Nome
orgCostCenter.hint: All orders placed through your organization's purchase account are linked to a cost center for tracking purposes. Each unit can have multiple cost centers. To limit spending, budgets are assigned to cost centers. A buyer selects a cost center when checking out.

messages.deactivate: Disabled cost centers cannot be used for placing new orders. Ensure that your unit has at least one cost center. Existing orders are not affected.

info.disabledEdit: Enable the cost center to allow editing.
info.disabledEnable: Unit must be enabled before this cost center may be enabled.

orgBudget.name: Nome
orgBudget.hint: Budgets set overall purchase limits and are assigned to cost centers. A buyer selects a cost center when checking out.

messages.deactivate: Disabled budgets no longer apply to the cost centers they are assigned to. Ensure that the associated cost center has at least one budget.

info.disabledEdit: Enable the budget to allow editing.
info.disabledEnable: Unit must be enabled before this budget may be enabled.

orgUnit.name: Nome
orgUnit.hint: Units represent departments, stores, regions, or any other logical grouping that makes sense to you. The cost centers and delivery addresses available to a buyer when checking out, depend on their unit. Users have access to all child units of their primary unit.

details.title: Detalhes da unidade
details.subtitle: Unit: {{ item.name }}
details.hint: Units represent departments, stores, regions, or any other logical grouping that makes sense to you. Disabling a unit disables all children of the unit, including child units, users, approvers, and cost centers. Disabled units cannot be edited.

messages.deactivate: Disabling a unit has wide-ranging affects on your commerce organization. ALL the unit's child units, users, budgets, and cost centers will also disabled.

info.disabledEdit: Enable the unit to allow editing.
info.disabledEnable: Parent must be enabled before this unit may be enabled.
info.disabledDisable: Root unit can not be disabled.

form.parentOrgUnitNotes: This unit is the top-level unit for your organization. It cannot be assigned to another unit.

instructions.check: To assign a role to a user, select the role's check box.
instructions.uncheck: To remove a role, clear the role's check box.

instructions.check: To assign an approver to this unit, select the user's check box.
instructions.uncheck: To remove an approver, clear the user's check box.

assignApprovers.hint: Users displayed under the Approvers list are assigned approval privileges for the buyers of this unit and of child units. Note that a user who has the approver role is separate from an approver who appears under the Approvers list. If an approver doesn't exist for a unit, or if approvers do not have sufficient approval purchase privileges, an approver higher up the unit hierarchy is found, until an administration is chosen.

orgUnitChildren.title: Child units
orgUnitChildren.subtitle: Unit: {{item.name}}

info.disabledCreate: Child unit can not be created for disabled unit.

orgUnitChildren.hint: Units represent departments, stores, regions, or any other logical grouping that makes sense to you. Users "inherit" child units, meaning buyers have access to cost centers and delivery addresses of child units when checking out.

orgUnitAssignedApprovers.title: Assigned approvers
orgUnitAssignedApprovers.subtitle: Unit: {{item.name}}
orgUnitAssignedApprovers.hint: Users displayed under the Approvers list are assigned approval privileges for the buyers of this unit and of child units. Note that a user who has the approver role is separate from an approver who appears under the Approvers list. If an approver doesn't exist for a unit, or if approvers do not have sufficient approval purchase privileges, an approver higher up the unit hierarchy is found, until an administration is chosen.

orgUnitUsers.title: Assigned users
orgUnitUsers.subtitle: Unit: {{item.name}}

info.disabledCreate: User can not be created for disabled unit.

orgUnitUsers.hint: Users are the buyers, approvers, managers, and administrators of your organization. Each user is assigned a role for making or approving purchases. Users "inherit" child units, meaning buyers have access to cost centers and delivery addresses of child units when checking out.

orgUnitCostCenters.title: Assigned cost centers
orgUnitCostCenters.subtitle: Unit: {{item.name}}

info.disabledCreate: Cost center can not be created for disabled unit.

orgUnitCostCenters.hint: All orders placed through your organization's purchase account are linked to a cost center for tracking purposes. A buyer selects a cost center when checking out using the "Account" purchase method. Each unit can have multiple cost centers, but a single cost center can only be assigned to a single unit. To define ultimate spending limits, budgets are assigned to cost centers.

orgUnitAddress.title: Delivery addresses
orgUnitAddress.subtitle: Unit: {{item.name}}
orgUnitAddress.hint: When a buyer is checking out using the "Account" purchase method, they much choose a cost center. The delivery addresses available to the buyer depend on the unit of the cost center chosen.

messages.delete: The address cannot be brought back. Existing orders are not affected.

orgUserGroup.name: Nome
orgUserGroup.hint: User groups allow you to combine users together in one group, for the purposes of assigning purchase limits for many users at once.

messages.delete: The users in this group are not affected when the user group is deleted.

orgUser.name: Nome
orgUser.title: Título
orgUser.hint: Users are the buyers, approvers, managers, and administrators of your organization. Each user is assigned a role for making or approving purchases. Each user belongs to a unit, and they have access to all child units of their primary unit.
orgUser.assignApprover: Add the user to approvers for the unit

messages.deactivate: Disabled users cannot log onto the storefront and place orders.

info.disabledEdit: Enable the user to allow editing.
info.disabledEnable: Unit must be enabled before this user may be enabled.

instructions.check: To assign an approver to this user, select the user's check box.
instructions.uncheck: To remove an approver, clear the user's check box.

instructions.check: To assign an user group to this user, select the user's check box.
instructions.uncheck: To remove aa user group, clear the user's check box.

instructions.check: To assign a purchase limits to this user, select its check box.
instructions.uncheck: To unassign a purchase limits, clear its check box.

orgPurchaseLimit.name: Nome
orgPurchaseLimit.hint: Purchase limits help control spending by defining how much buyers can spend per order or per week, month, quarter, or year. Purchase limits are assigned to users or user groups. Purchase limits are also assigned to approvers, defining how much they are permitted to approve. You can assign purchase limits to many users at once with user groups.

messages.deactivate: Disabled purchase limits can no longer be assigned to a user or user group. Current assignments will have no effect.

info.disabledEdit: Enable the purchase limit to allow editing.
info.disabledEnable: Unit must be enabled before this purchase limit may be enabled.
